alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 8:15PM CDT until April 13 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR MOORE AND LINCOLN COUNTIES... At 814 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Shelbyville to 6 miles south of Petersburg to 11 miles west of Fayetteville to Ardmore, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Ardmore, Petersburg, Tims Ford Lake, Lincoln, Howell, Elora, Hurdlow and Mimosa. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
